review.itemreviewed: Flare Gun Stretch Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a great shirt and it looks great. I have long arms and it is difficult to find a shirt that fits my arm length well. This one does the trick and I have already purchased a second shirt because it fits so well. I wasn't sure if I would like this black shirt pattern, but I am very pleased with it. It really looks great. The only negative is that the sleeve cuffs button pretty tight which makes it practically impossible to pull back in order to see my watch. This is a common problem with a lot of these kind of shirts regardless of brand, so I have learned to deal with it. I love Columbia products and am very happy with this purchase.
review.name: Fits Great, Looks Great! I love it

review.itemreviewed: Flare Gun Stretch Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: The shirt size and fit are perfect.  Flannel is soft and sturdy, color is exactly as shown.
review.name: What a shirt!

review.itemreviewed: Flare Gun Stretch Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great light weight, warm and stylish flannel. Overall I am happy with the purchase. This Flare Gun Flannel does run a little on the small side. I did the 'Fit Predictor' which suggested a LARGE would be the best fit. I actually wish I had bought the XL. Large is a bit SLIM in the shoulders and a little short in the body length and arms. The fit is just at my minimum length in both body and arms and I like the color, so I kept it. I am taller than the average bear and only 10lbs above average. Shirts are typically a little shorter than desired and I roll up the sleeves on most casual L/S shirts. Overall it's probably spot on for the 'US Average Male' (5'9" @ 197lbs). If you are a little taller or have wide shoulders, size up to the XL fo a little more room. Also to note: this does not fit like the the Silver Ridge L/S shirts (I wear a MED in those w/out a problem) so be aware of the variance when purchasing.
review.name: Light Weight, Warm, Stylish - City Grey Big Check

review.itemreviewed: Flare Gun Stretch Flannel Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Like it very much, will recommend it
review.name: Confortamble !

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect , my wife loves me more when I wear it.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Sirrus 24L Backpack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Every stich was planned. Very nice alllll day pack.
review.name: Every stich was planned. Very

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent fit and features! I am petite and it fits my torso perfectly.
review.name: Excellent fit and features! I

review.reviewBody: First let me say, I'm a fan of osprey packs however this daypack doesn't seem to pack well imo. If you put a full bladder in the pack, it doesn't leave a lot of space for anything else. I felt it had too many pockets and zippers which just added to the weight. The hipbelt pockets were too small to hold a regular iphone. I had to return it, hopefully it will be updated.
review.name: Over engineered

review.reviewBody: I have two other Osprey packs and love the women-specific features. I bought this Sirrus for casual hiking and walking to town for groceries and other supplies. I got the right fit after watching a Youtube that showed that the hipbelt pad in front should be centered over the pelvic bone - not above it as I had incorrectly done. The torso adjustment "ladder" is a nice feature. I am 5'7" and measured my torso at 15.6", and found the second shortest adjustment to work the best at keeping the shoulder straps from riding up. This is really a comfortable and well fitting pack for me.
review.name: Great fit; nice daypack

review.reviewBody: Regular iPhone doesn't fit in hip pockets and there's nowhere to carry your phone in the pack for easy access. This is a super annoying! Everyone needs easy phone access- whether it be to access downloaded trail map info or for taking photos. I didn't like the way that trekking poles are stowed either. They kept coming loose and swinging (It could've been due to the hiking terrain of climbing and bending?) Apart from that, the pack was very comfortable on a 12 mile hike with a lot of bouldering and climbing. I'm 5'9 and the fit was perfect. I wouldn't buy this pack again or recommend it- there are other packs out there that can accommodate a phone.
review.name: Nowhere to carry phone for easy access

review.reviewBody: The pack is sturdy, has lots of pockets and has useful features like a whistle, attachable rain cover and breathable back. Unfortunately I can’t use it as the pockets on the hip straps are placed right where my forearms hit. They leave rub burns on my arms and there doesn’t seem to be a way to solve the problem. I’ve tried several times with the same issue to the point I’ve taken the pack off during a hike. I’m disappointed as I really wanted it to work but can’t get around the pockets brushing against my arms.
review.name: Beautiful pack with one problem

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love love love Osprey packs! I own an outdoor adventure school so I have only Osprey packs for my students to use. I feel if I’ve introducing people to outdoor adventures they should use gear that ensures they will enjoy the journey. Also, students like to use what I use. I bought a new Sirrus 24 so I could have a new color and cycled my old one but still in great condition, to the gear room!
review.name: Love love love Osprey packs!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the color of this bag! My boyfriend has a much older Osprey of this volume/size and mine seems like it could hold much more than the older one. So far I’ve hiked with it here and there but not carried too much weight in it and it’s been fantastic. The waist belt is taking a little longer to break in due to the thickness of the side pouches, but I’m sure it will wear in soon!
review.name: I love the color of

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] M husband and I each bought this pack for the Portuguese Camino, having to carry all of our gear for a two week trek. Great pack for our purpose! Lots of places to stash things we needed more immediate access too, easy to adjust straps to fit. Lightweight. Looks good too!
review.name: M husband and I each

review.reviewBody: Pack arrived quickly and is super high quality! I loaded the pack super heavy and did a 10 mile hike and the vent in the back area was amazing - kept my back cool. And the straps kept the pack in place and comfortable. Awesome pack! Definitely recommend it!
review.name: Awesome pack!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I will always and forever be a Hydroflask fan! I really love how the tumblers and bottles are built, and they always have really cute colors and designs! The tumbler has been perfect for my iced coffee's that get, and it keeps my drink nice, cold and crispy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am absolutely HOOKED on these tumblers, only I use mine for my daily latte!!! I love collecting my favorite colors!
review.name: I am absolutely HOOKED

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Disappointed that lid seems thinner, or lacking same insulation, as my previous cup w lid from a few years back. Ice melts overnight which didn’t happen before.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing, we love our Hydroflask tumblers. This one was purchased for one of our little cousins who loved our 32 oz cups and wanted her own. This is a great size for a child or teen. Cute, functional, and keeps your drink cold for hours!
review.name: Amazing tumbler for a preteen

review.reviewBody:
this is an awesome tumbler but the problem is that the straw looks dingy pretty quick. I have contacted hydro flask and they will/do not sell replacement colored
straws so you must try to go through warranty process every time the straw looks funky. Great idea if
they would sell replacement colored straws.
review.name: straw looks dirty quick

review.reviewBody: This cup is very pretty and the perfect size whoever my drink doesn’t stay as cold as long as my other hydro flask do. Also having difficulty with the straw the cup doesn’t have enough airflow for the water to come up the straw I’ve tried many things to get it to work. Little disappointed in this design.
review.name: Disappointed

review.itemreviewed: Always Beyond Long-Sleeve Crew T-Shirt 2.0 - Men's
review.reviewBody: I order this for my son in a size large along with a couple other items and he Loves all of them. I tried this on myself and it was too big on me but I lover it and am thinking of ordering one for myself. It's so soft and I love that it's lightweight. Good to wear alone or layer under something when it's really cold.
review.name: It's Great!

review.itemreviewed: Always Beyond Long-Sleeve Crew T-Shirt 2.0 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love BY fabric, but there are 3 plastic labels sewn into the inside the shirt that scratches my skin. I cut the label at the dotted line, but now there a 1/4” sharp plastic label scratching me. The real problem is that these labels are sewn into the main seam of the shirt. I tried and failed to remove the label and now I have a hole in my shirt. 
I have several BY shirts I am unable to wear nor remove the label. Please reconsider a different labeling system. I have stopped buying your product. Very sad.
review.name: Labels in shirts

review.itemreviewed: Always Beyond Long-Sleeve Crew T-Shirt 2.0 - Men's
review.reviewBody: Held off for months waiting for them to bring back Featherweight. Vastly prefer the lighter weight and looser fit and longer sleeves. Finally emailed, heard it might not come back. Reluctantly ordered more Always Beyond—only to discover it’s now what they’re calling Featherweight! But the picture still shows the crazy fit of Always Beyond. INCREDIBLY confusing & a complete fail at the level of marketing. But IMO a great decision to stick with the Featherweight product line, whatever they call it.
review.name: *Always Beyond* is now *Featherweight*

review.itemreviewed: Always Beyond Long-Sleeve Crew T-Shirt 2.0 - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love the terry cloth track suit! Feels
Amazing and easy to pair for a more elevated look.
review.name: So soft and flattering

review.reviewBody: Other than the ridiculous delay with the shipping carrier , the product itself is good . Only have used it once but it’s serves its purpose .

I wear the Women's SunGaitor for bike riding. The pony cut keeps the gaitor up and better protects my face from the Glorida sun. Great air flow. 
It is a little short in the neck and wants to float above my shirt.
review.name: Great for any outdoor sport

review.reviewBody:
FINALLY!!!!! I have been hoping to find a buff that has a hair home and here it is!!! I absolutely love how this fits! The breathing holes are perfect size! It comes up over my hat to help keep my hat on when flying down the water at all speeds!! And the hair hole!!!!! OMG!! Can we just talk about that for a second?!!?? Not many companies understand that lady anglers have different needs than the men do!! This is a BIG one!! It’s fantastic to be able to have my hair out through my hat and not have to be smashed into buff making it tighter!! I wish I had found this sooner!! 
Buy it!!!
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody:
Purchased two of these one for each my wife and daughter. 
They love them fit, style and comfort are Uber nice!
I love it especially that I’m able to put my ponytail through it

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Fairview Trek 50L Travel Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Fairview Trek 50L Travel Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Fairview Trek 50L Travel Pack online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] this pack is fabulous. it is a perfect fit, so comfortable even when fully loaded. the design is excellent & the carrying capacity top notch. i highly recommend.
review.name: this pack is fabulous. it

review.reviewBody: Having worked in the outdoor retail industry, I've kept my eye on travel bags for sometime. This is the only pack I've found that can deliver on what I need for traveling. My international travel typically involves considerable hiking or backpacking, and my equipment needs to be portable, durable, and versatile. If you need a pack that can be safely checked on an airplane, has a robust suspension system, is highly adjustable, includes a rain cover (it fits fine), that is super comfortable, is easy to pack, and that can handle a few days of backpacking, this is a winner. Because it doesn't have tons of pockets, I have found it works best to have packing cubes and other organizing sacks in the pack. I truly love this pack and have considered buying the 70L version. Well done, Osprey. It's surprising to me that more people don't know about this pack.
review.name: Best pack on the market for a combo of travel & backpacking

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag for a 9 day international trip to Norway. I used the bag as a carryon with no problems. It fit everything I needed it to, including camping gear. We did not do any long hiking but I did buy it with that in mind. The straps were adjustable and comfortable. I think this bag is great for the dual purpose of large travel and hiking. The main reason I got this bag was the way it easily opens the large pocket. If I was strictly hiking I would go for a bag with more pockets and straps.
review.name: Great bag for international travel

review.reviewBody: Very nice bag. Easy to adjust and comfortable. The only thing that is wrong is the rain cover. It is design to be both airplane transporter (you put in bag in it, zip it, and check your bag) and rain cover. However, the rain cover does not fit tightly around the bag. Therefore, bag is not protecteur at all during rain storms. I regret buying the bag.
review.name: Nice bag but...

review.reviewBody:
First, this pack has a movable back plate so that you can adjust the size for a perfect fit.  I can hardly tell I'm wearing it!

I have packed this bag 2 or three times to see just how much I can fit for my 3 month trip overseas next fall through Christmas   This is exactly the bag I have been waiting for. 

The color is not red, it's more of a copper.  It's pretty, but not as pretty as the purple which I was never able to get except in the 7OL which is entirely too big!  

There are pockets galore, and lots of hidden and a few hidden ones for valuables.  

Can't say it enough I love this bag.
review.name: Love this pack!

name: Fairview Trek 50L Travel Pack

review.itemreviewed: MX242 Endurance Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Sorry, but there's nothing wide about these.  Build quality is fine but these are supposed to be some of the widest shoes out there, that is how they are advertised, and there is nothing special about the width. Even with the flexible material it is still a width aggravation and that flexible material I'm sure is somewhat durable but not as durable as any non-mesh outer. I found the Pearl Izumi X- Alp Summit much wider and retails for only $150.  I'm not trying to dog out this shoe too heavy but everything I'm stating is in my opinion completely accurate. See attached image compared to the Izumi.  Notice how the left toe box area of the Izumi stays wide compared to the left side of the Lake shoe, which cuts across much more diagonally.  From what I understand this cutting in of the toe box is for aerodynamics, I'm just saying if you want actual width I would definitely go with the Izumi.  I put the shoe on for 5 seconds and immediately it just didn't work and I returned them.
review.name: Not wide at all

review.itemreviewed: MX242 Endurance Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: These are really pricey, but the best MTB clipless shoes I've found for wide feet.
review.name: Great for wide feet

review.itemreviewed: MX242 Endurance Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased the MX242 wide's and they alleviated my foot issues.  I have ridden 30,000 miles in the last decade and at age 67 my foot somehow became a little wider.  As such, my traditional road bike shoes gave me severe pain after 3 or 4 hours of riding, because they were too narrow and squeezed my foot.  If you ever had something like this happen, it literally can suck the joy out of biking. 

This past weekend, I completed the Ride Across Wisconsin in the MX242 wide's.  It was my fist pain-free ride in two months and I almost had a PR.  I appreciate that Brian S, a Completive Cyclist personal gear head, guided me through my issues and recommended these new shoes.  

John M, Chicago 
August 20, 2024
review.name: Lake - MX242 Endurance Wide Shoes

review.itemreviewed: MX242 Endurance Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have had good luck w Lakes before.  I didn’t want to drop 4-500 on Sidis.  These are comfortable and they comform to multiple foot sizes due to the way they have strips of leather that tighten up individually.   I have ridden them hard on a few 2-3 hr rides and happy with comfort.
review.name: Great shoe for wide foot MTB racer

review.itemreviewed: MX242 Endurance Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been cycling on the road for years and decided to join my cycling friends on the gravel as well. These gravel shoes are very comfortable and would recommend them.
review.name: Great Gravel shoe

name: MX242 Endurance Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: i bought a pair of these cause i was caught out on a trip to the bike park and forgot my knee pads. they run a full size small which is not a big deal I was able to try them on. i always wear medium knee pads but the mediums in these i could not even put on. but i really doubt if these are very protective, when you push on the front you can easily feel your kneecap. even my troy lee stage knee pads feel way more protective.
review.name: do not seem protective

review.reviewBody: I received 2 left knee pads. Not the first person this happened to based on some other reviews I found on other sites.
review.name: Poor Quality Control

review.reviewBody:
I'm pretty skinny (6'6" 188lbs), and size large is great. I like how they're soft. They're not bulky at all. I don't notice them too much when riding. 

It's a pretty simple product that seems to do the trick. I haven't had a significant crash in them, so I can only speak to the fit and comfort.
review.name: They do their thing!

review.reviewBody: Purchased for my 11 yo son thinking a men's small would be big enough.  Product looks and appears to be well made, looking to return for a medium.
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody: Great alternative between stiff bulky knee pads and neoprene sleeves.  I wore them for the better part of 140 miles over 6 days of riding in mid 90's (Moab) weather.  At first, I though it was going to be massively uncomfortable, but once on the bike in riding position, I nearly forgot I had them on.   I'm 6'3", 200# and I ordered a size Large.  Fit was perfect.  Tight enough to stay in place without cutting off circulation or causing any rubbing issues.  Ventilation is adequate, but I did push them down on extended climbs.   Happy to report no crash tests though.
review.name: Comfort and Protection-Finally

review.reviewBody: I bought these for the downhill park. The strap on top is really nice, makes it easy to get over bike shoes and then you can strap it down tight once on your legs. These are really great because they are not super bulky but have protection on the both the top and sides of legs. They have a nice stretch to them, so they are more flexible and comfortable to wear all day. I have had a few good falls on them on some hard rocks, and material stay in place.
review.name: Great Flex with Good Protection

review.reviewBody: Nice fit and keeps you dry - was at track meet in down pour and did it job. Last jacket last 15 years
review.name: Lightweight rain coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I wasn’t sure how this would fit me as a plus size petite person. The 1x worked perfectly for me (I am 5’2” and 200 lbs). I got it for a trip to PNW National Parks and have worn it for walks and hikes locally and it’s perfectly light and waterproof. Very breathable! Inn be love that it has a two piece zipper so you can unzip the bottom a bit for more room for walking. Perfect rain jacket for me!
review.name: Perfect! Fits great

review.reviewBody:
Purchased a replacement for lost original and bought one for daughter and wife. 

It is light, waterproof and wind protective. Performs well even in low temp, despite its lack of insulation. Blocks wind and seals in body heat when vents are closed.
review.name: Precip is tops in versatility and protection

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fantastic lightweight rain jacket! I am involved in scouting and it’s important to have great gear that can pack up in a backpack. Everyone in my family had one of these. The fact that it can zip up into the pocket is awesome!
review.name: Great lightweight jacket!

review.reviewBody: Wore this jacket in a downpour and got soaked. I like so many other things about this jacket but absolutely would not recommend it for rainwear.
review.name: Nice jacket for wind but not for staying dry
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for providing us with feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
 
We are very sorry to hear that you are experiencing some issues with the PreCip jacket. In order to get repair assessment or advice, please fill out a Warranty Claim on our website under:
 
https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html
 
If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST
 
Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Worth every penny!  Extremely durable, easy to pack, great wind break, amazing breathability, and 100% waterproof.  Exactly what I needed. Marmot knocks it out of the park yet again!
review.name: go to rain coat...

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The size chart isn’t accurate. Size up at least one full size based on your measurements. That being said, I like the jacket. Given the longevity issues noted by other reviewers, I would not have paid full price. I am typically a size 16 and got the 2X even though a xxl should have fit.
review.name: Size chart inaccurate

review.reviewBody: Nice shell jacket, runs small (for me anyway) so I had to return and reorder. Customer service was very quick so it was not an issue.
review.name: This will be a great layer!

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket a couple of weeks ago but was so disappointed when it arrived. It’s a great looking jacket but it runs REALLY small. I normally wear a 2X but a 3X was too small.
review.name: Great jacket RUNS SMALL

review.reviewBody: I bought this for a trip to the Olympic peninsula. I sure it during a torrential rain during a hike through the Hoh rainforest. Which I think may be the wettest place in the US lol. I stayed dry! The whole time. My only suggestion is to wear like a baseball cap because I think with the hood pulled all the way up I couldn’t see well enough to look up and around and everything I wanted to see. But overall did the job it fit well and I was dry!
review.name: Rainforest -stayed dry !

name: PreCip Eco Plus Jacket - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Salewa markets these as mountaineer trainers but they are excellent for many other uses too. Right out of the box they are comfortable and get even better as they break in. The grip is fantastic and the height on the ankle is perfect for support without being cumbersome; just what you want in a mid-top. I don’t know how they squeezed this durability and quality into a boot this lightweight. I use primarily for hunting and hiking and these things are bulletproof.
review.name: Incredible all-purpose boots

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fit. System cinches down the ankle pocket for a secure fit. Great traction. Very comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for structure climbing I do for rope access/inspection work and they are awesome. I’ve tried different hiking shoe brands and these are by far my favorite they are super comfortable, sturdy, and grippy.
review.name: Excellent boot

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use these for every day outside work, cutting wood, going to town, and beebopping around. They're stiff, but feel broken in at the same time. A little on the heavy side, but hopefully durable.
review.name: great boots

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I wanted boots for quick excursions and day hiking, that don’t completely look ridiculous when worn off the trail…these fit the bill.  They blend form and function well.  The waterproof leather so far, is holding up.  It’s a bit thin, but it allows for more flexibility and lighter weight.  The vibram outsole is fantastic.  The chevron pattern offers impecable traction on a variety of surfaces, even when wet (I’m primarily in the eastern woodlands of the US).  The foam midsole is fine, it offers some cushion, and offers a good balance of stability to flexibility.  Where I think this boot really falls flat, are in the 3F lacing system, and the Multi-fit footbed.  I don’t find the 3F system actually locks my heel in place.  Even with different heel locking lacing techniques, I get heel-slip leading to blisters after only about an hour of wear on moderate terrain.  Also, the laces are so thin, it’s painful for my fingers to actually pull the laces taught (they do look cool though).  The Multi-fit footbed (MFF) is a brilliant idea, but the foam is so thin and flimsy, it barely makes a difference in comfort.  I wound up putting in a pair of Kneed hiking insoles, and that has helped tremendously on treks longer than 2 hours.  The flex collar, is actually really effective!  It’s always been such a pain for my Achilles tendons wearing traditional hiking boots on descents, and this flex collar is a genuine game changer.  So big ups to Salewa for implementing that.  Overall, solid, good looking  day hikers, but definitely a bit gimicky.  Double socking is enough to manage blisters from the ineffective 3F system, and 3rd party insoles make up for the poor MFF.
review.name: Cool concepts, lackluster execution

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I use these for work, hiking . The only thing im not sure about is the insoles would likely trade out for a better pair. but they are still comfortable
review.name: very comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boot fit and feel great! Wore them 12 hours straight the first time putting them on and had zero issues.  They are light and not too rigid, feel good walking around in doors and out. Temperature in northern MN was in the mid 30’s and the last hour or so my feet started to get cold but with no insulation and thin socks it was to be expected! No complaints, great boot!
review.name: Great fit, great look!

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: These boots will last forever if you take care of them I’m on my second pair and the first one lasted over 10 years
review.name: Perfect fit, and longevity

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great fit out of the box. I'm a wider foot and like to let my toes splay out. I sized up 1/2 a US size and they fit wonderfully.

review.itemreviewed: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great quality and perfect fit
review.name: Great boots

name: Alp Trainer 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Seeker 4L Water Bottle
hasVariant.description: Buy the Hydrapak Seeker 4L Water Bottle online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Top of the line the seeker will not let me down.  It probably will out last me!
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: Does a much better job of fitting into a bicycle frame bag than other 2-3L bladders which have all sorts of extra plastic handles or huge lids or straps or etc. If all you're trying to do is carry a lot of water, then grab one of these. If you're trying to drink from it while riding, then grab the lid adapter and attach a tube to it and you're A+++ ready to ultra race.
review.name: Fits where other bladders don't

review.reviewBody: I have the stash bottles and use them everyday and I decided to buy the 4L seeker bottle. I currently live in a van and always am worried about running out of water on the go. Being able to put that in my pocket and then fill it when I go out on a walk or to a happy hour or getting groceries is so nice. It’s just big enough to carry back/fill anywhere.
review.name: Hydrapak is made for van life

review.reviewBody: Excellent quality and worked as advertised, a great product
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: Good strong material. Perfect size for collecting water with an opening large enough to easily fill.
review.name: Love it, exactly what I wanted

review.reviewBody: Great product. Functions as advertised. Love the multiple attachment point available. Fits my Be free filter:)
review.name: Solid product

review.reviewBody: Very happy. Lightweight, great seal on the lid/cap, and very durable overall. Would buy again!
review.name: Seeker

review.reviewBody: I had the older blue model of the Seeker 4L and it ended up with a tiny hole in it near the collar. It was still useable with the size of the hole, so I reached out to HydraPak for options on how to patch the hole and they offered to replace mine no questions asked. I sent them a few pics and they had a new one in the mail within a few days. I use this for car camping with the shower spigot attachment and it works great for washing up, refilling water bottles, etc. Solid products and excellent customer service!
review.name: Excellent products and customer service!

review.reviewBody: My second seeker. I bought these for all the work travel I do and thenhope to cut down on plastic water bottles. I usually refill at the hotel gym water cooler or airport fountains. Works great. Planning on using this second one to replace my CamelBak for a 1200 mile bike ride this summer.
review.name: Great flexibility and mobility

review.reviewBody:
I purchased a Seeker 4L and 2L for a desert water carry after being impressed by product videos showing how resilient these bags are.

After receiving the bags, I filled them up while doing a full prep-pack for my trip. The materials felt high quality and the bags were sturdy.  Everything seemed okay until I noticed that the side of my backpack was wet. At first, I figured it was excess water in the cap threads that had leaked out, but there was too much water. I checked my internal reservoir to make sure it hadn’t been punctured, but it was fine.

Finally, I held the 2 Seeker bags upside down over a sink and sure enough they started dripping, slowly but enough to be a problem. I threaded and re-threaded the caps over and over again, but couldn’t make the drips stop. I thought I had it figured out and left them on their sides on paper towel overnight to see, but the next morning the counter was soaked.

I still used the bags on the trip because I had to take something, but was constantly stopping to check that they were upright and not soaking through my pack.

I’m open to this being an issue of user error, but it also shouldn’t take this much time/effort to put a lid on a container.

Tl;dr
The leakproof caps leak.
review.name: Not leakproof

name: Seeker 4L Water Bottle

review.reviewBody: I bought these poles as a back up plan after being diagnosed with an injury a week before my first 50 mile ultra race. I only practiced with these poles once before the race and found them super easy to use and store in the Solomon quiver that I have. If it wasn’t for these poles, I would not have finished that race. These poles helped me so much and were so light and comfortable. They essentially add no weight in the quiver and are so easy to operate with one click of a button. I highly recommend these trekking poles!
review.name: Great Ultra poles

review.reviewBody:
Very light, easy to manage.
This is my 4th set over the years. Once used it never wants to be another kind of pole.
review.name: Very light, easy to manage.

review.reviewBody: I bought the Z poles to take on a trip where my regular collapsing poles wouldn't fit in my checked bag. The Z poles were perfect. I know you're supposed to lengthen/shorten when going down/up, but I never do. I bought the poles that fit me for level terrain and they were wonderful. These are light and sturdy, and I'm planning to use them more often.
review.name: Terrific poles

review.reviewBody: Easy to operate while on the run. Lightweight and doesn't even feel like its there.
review.name: Distance Z

review.reviewBody:
Used these in the trekking/hiking sections of Expedition Oregon Adventure Race. They did excellent on hiking up and down super steep hills both on and off of trails. The Z folding feature is perfect for fitting in your pack when you don’t need them.
I’m 5’5” and the 110cm ones were perfect for me.
review.name: Excellent for Expedition Adventure Races

review.reviewBody: Having the “z” fold up is so great, and it’s easy to deploy! Used them for the first time in a 50 mile race and really enjoyed them. I tried my friends carbon z’s and those were awesome too..
review.name: Awesome poles

review.reviewBody: Enjoying these a lot, have a nice balance and seem light without being fragile. An excellent tool for technical trail and long days.
review.name: Light yet sturdy

review.reviewBody: I’ve put these to the test on a couple challenging runs in the White Mountains of NH. They are great going up and down through all kinds of terrain especially in the rocky trails of the Whites. Super light weight. Easy to deploy and equally easy to attach to my pack on the move. My only criticism is the grips and the hand straps could use a bit more cushioning but not a deal breaker for me. Definitely recommend for those who like to fly through the mountains!
review.name: Great for trail running

review.reviewBody: Took these poles on a three day backpack in the Ansel Adams Wilderness and they were great!
review.name: Love these poles

review.reviewBody: I've had two sets of poles that become almost impossible to fold or extend. They aren't super expensive, but if you have to buy a new pair each year...So disappointing.
review.name: Really good for a short time

name: Distance Z Trekking Poles

review.reviewBody: Feels plastic and cheap. Zipper is annoying. Design makes it difficult to reach in for drinks and nearly impossible to fully drain out melted ice water after use. A failed design.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] the zipper broke on my discountinued cooler backpack, so I emailed hydro flask to see if they would just fix the zipper. instead they said to send back the item and they would replace it with the new version. total time was about two weeks from first email to them. amazing service! I've always liked their products but now I'm a customer for life.
review.name: warranty replacement

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This pack was a warranty replacement. The original pack was fantastic, but the zipper broke on the main compartment, so I made a warranty claim. Hydroflask was great and guaranteed the pack. It was replaced and the new one is very nice with a better zipper configuration that looks to have a little more longevity built into it. Can’t wait to pack it with my craft beer and get out in the country!
review.name: CRAFT PACK IN VT

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love my Day Escape, I had to purchase a second because my son uses mine all the time. I use it as a carry-on suitcase so I have a cooler on my beach vacations.
review.name: Day Escape

review.reviewBody: This new version of their backpack cooler is terrible. Extremely hard to get into the cooler and get what you’re looking for. The opening I designed in such a way that you cannot see what you have in the cooler. Very small opening.
review.name: Terrible new version

name: 20L Day Escape Soft Cooler Pack

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very happy with the product! Warm and comfortable.
review.name: Great shirt/fleece

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great product. Good for hiking, hunting, everyday and office use. Mixture of everything. Sizing is true. I'm 6'2 and 185 and bought a large
review.name: Multifunctional

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my new go to mid layer! its lightweight and breaths well but us still plenty warm! I have been using it for a few months and so far no signs of wear.
review.name: Fantastic mid layer

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's
review.reviewBody: I got one for me and my husband. We do a lot of outdoor sports especially in the winter. This is a fantastic base layer. It is a cross between Melanzana and Patagonia in technology, with its stitching, thickness, and breath ability. Just to add to the greatness, they have fantastic colors. I got my husband the blue and myself the purple lilac. I would recommend this to anyone. Absolutely in love.
review.name: Great pullover

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's
review.reviewBody: Got it on sale and it is very much worth it when discounted. Perfect casual pullover for around town and home use. I have not put it through any serious outdoor use but it keeps me warm running errands in 30s/40s with just a t-shirt underneath. Incredibly comfortable material and have received several compliments. Fit for me is trim and perfect could sneak some light layers underneath if I wanted too. Measurements: 6ft 175 Size: Large
review.name: Great Casual Pullover

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great weight- excellent layering piece or stand alone. The waffle design is unique. I have 2 and keep them in the rotation multiple days a week.
review.name: Nice all around pull over

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is the best 3/4 button sweater I have had. Comfortable, warm when I need it to be, cool when I need it to be. Has pockets that blend in. I get tons of compliments about it. I have worn it daily for nearly a month since ordering it.
review.name: I would buy 3 in each size & color so I will always have one

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's
review.reviewBody: Hiked a couple times on cold, windy days and it performed well. Much more wind resistant than I expected for its weight. Recommend sizing up if using as a mid layer.
review.name: Light and functional

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's
review.reviewBody: Feels great Looks great Goes great Layers great Had to buy another color because I really liked it.
review.name: Just all around great

review.itemreviewed: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A great all around pullover with a sharp look. The kalamata and blue color contrast is striking. It's lightweight so packs up nicely, but also seems plenty warm. Could be just as good on a backpacking trip as casual wear. Some have complained about a weird fit around the belly but it seemed normal to me.
review.name: Stylish, versatile, and cozy pullover

name: Trail Mix Snap Pullover Fleece - Men's

review.itemreviewed: RecoveryTherm Hot and Cold Vibration Knee
review.reviewBody: I found the coverage of the heating/cooling to be lacking, particularly considering how bulky it is. It only cools on specific plates on the device, which didn’t touch my kneecap or some of the areas around it that I really needed.   Ended up getting they hyperice one instead which I’ve been much happier with!

review.itemreviewed: RecoveryTherm Hot and Cold Vibration Knee
review.reviewBody:
I received this a few weeks ago and I have used almost every day and my knees are improving so I continue to run every day , before I her this I couldn’t run but a couple a days a week now I can run whenever I want 
I recommend this to anyone with know problems 
The heat and ice is perfect
review.name: Works Great and The Best knee therapy

review.itemreviewed: Belle Isle Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Jacket was true to size and quite warm ,great value i would recommend purchasing it
review.name: Happy with the purchase

review.itemreviewed: Belle Isle Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’m 5’10” and this jacket hits right above the knees for me. Arm length is perfect. Heavier weight jacket than I was expecting, which isn’t a bad thing! Super comfortable and I’ve gotten several complements about it whenever it’s cold enough for me to wear it!
review.name: Warm and cute jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Belle Isle Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Warm and not too thick, cozy and love the hood.  Excited to wear this winter, classic
review.name: Mid Down Jacket

review.itemreviewed: Belle Isle Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I like the color and fit, it's pretty warm! But this jacket is constantly shedding and losing down feathers from the seams. At first I thought maybe this is just something that happenings initially? But I've had the jacket for 3 months and the feathers are still coming out of the seams. So either I have a defective jacket or the jacket is poorly designed. By this time next winter there won't be any down filling left :(
review.name: ok except it loses feathers
comment: Thank you for sharing your experience with us, we have passed your feedback along.

review.itemreviewed: Belle Isle Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought this same coat as a gift. I liked it so much I bought one for myself. It is so warm & very comfortable. I really like the zipper that you can open at the bottom.
review.name: Parka

review.itemreviewed: Belle Isle Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I absolutely love this jacket. I did size up because I normally wear a sweatshirt or chunky sweater, but it is so warm and comfortable!
review.name: Absolutely Love!

review.itemreviewed: Belle Isle Mid Down Jacket - Women's

review.name: Good quality and warm

review.itemreviewed: Belle Isle Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best jacket ever, worth every penny, warm but does not make you sweat. Keeps you dry in weather.
review.name: Best jacket ever!!

review.itemreviewed: Belle Isle Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is a lovely coat, but I will be returning it because the front placket uses Velcro closures. I loathe Velcro and there is no mention of it in the product description. Too bad - this coat fits well and is the perfect length.
review.name: -1 Star for Velcro

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Girlfriend loves this. Looks good, comfy, and keeps her warm in the cold temps!

review.reviewBody: I am a perfect size M in the Flylow Daisy pants, and yet the size M in these Nina pants is WAY too tight.  Restricts movement around the butt.  Sort out your sizing, Flylow...
review.name: Love the pants... terrible fit

review.reviewBody: I purchased these to replace a previous version of Flylow's Sassyfrass pant I'd bought used from REI a few years ago that were just a bit snug, being a size Small.  Purchased the Nina in a medium and the fit is just awful - gaping in the waist, as others have described, and very tight and unforgiving in the hips and thighs.  I took these off and was MUCH more comfortable in the Small Sassyfrass that I currently own.  Will be returning.
review.name: Awful fit

review.reviewBody: These pants are way more comfortable and warm than I thought they'd be. I definitely run a little more hot blooded but I haven't felt cold in them yet, even with the east coast wind. They're stretchy and the adjustable straps are perfect. The color is definitely a little more dusty gray pink than they look online, but still really cute.
review.name: Love Them!!!

review.reviewBody: Have to fight the bottom of the ski pant around the top of the ski boots and buckle every time they are worn. Bottom of pant is narrow and does not have enough or any elasticity to make pulling the pant over ski boots easy and accessible. Poor design.
review.name: Poor design

review.reviewBody:
I was so excited to buy these pants on sale in my favorite color! I had a pair of Flylow Daisy pants in a medium that I've worn for 4-5 years, so I bought the medium in the Nina pant.  I was able to zip them up, but felt like a sausage. Way too tight.  I'm 5'4", 144, with strong quads from biking/skiing. I typically wear a medium in everything, and a 10 in jeans/pants. The Nina pants are cut very straight with no curves for a woman's shape. Too tight at the top, and really baggy  from the knees down. Strange. 

Otherwise, the quality looked excellent. If you're super slim and straight with no hips, these would be great, but sadly, I'll need to keep looking.
review.name: Great pants, but sizing off

review.reviewBody: For real. Ordered the same size as my other Flylow pants from a few seasons ago and these were so tight I could barely sit. Immediately returned. It's a bummer, because I love Flylow but their sizing is not inclusive at all.
review.name: the sizing feels like a cruel joke

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my wife because she needs snowboard pants that are super waterproof to avoid a wet & freezing butt all day on the slopes. These are definitely waterproof! They are a thick and fairly rigid "plastic" feeling material. But this also means that they did not give at all in their sizing and felt very rigid on her body. The fit was also just wrong. The hips and butt were so tight she could barely walk, but she had to cinch the waist a TON. Due to the rigid material, when she squatted down in a snowboard stance, the pants wanted to fall down in the back, despite the tight fit. It was all just wrong and uncomfortable. She really wishes these pants fit well because they are super high quality.
review.name: Great pant, bad fit - returned

review.reviewBody:
I orginally purchased a size Med.  I am 5'9" normnally a size 6 in pants..and the smallest thing about me is my hips/butt.   I could barely get them over my hips nevermind try to button my covid/wine/tostito belly so I returned for a L.    Large arrived, no problem with the fit except the front crotch area was so room you could store a pair of mittens down your pants and then the fit from the knee down was baggy and terrible.  Snowboard style mixed with a not bootcut but too baggy.    My husband asked if I had them on right. 

Positive note: the color (slate) as great and the pickets/zippers seem great.  I read the review here that were positive before purchase but should have paid more attn to the reviews on Flylow website that pretty much all said negative things about the fit.  maybe they just aren't meant for normal people bodies...
review.name: terrible fit

review.reviewBody: The color is delightful. The quality seems great. The fit was waaaay too small. I am short (so I was ready for them to be too long as everything is always too long for me). I usually wear a size 12-14 pant so I ordered the XL according to the size chart. Perhaps the size chart is not accurate? Either way, if that is the largest size available this brand does not make gear for woman with any meat on their bones.
review.name: Runs super small

review.reviewBody: I am a steady size 10 petite in pants. If anything, my pants can run big. Even the XL were too tight on my thighs, right at the meaty part of my quads. I bought too different pants and I really wanted to love them. Even my jacket, that I did like, gave me the feeling that it was really made for straighter women - it bunched up a bit at my hips.
review.name: Not made for curvy or muscular women

name: Nina Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack hoping it would feel my needs for a pack. It didn't disappoint. I really like the feel of the pack. It is comfortable and seems very well made.
review.name: Great Pack

review.reviewBody:
i hav3 3-4 ultralight bags, some are more expensive then this one. The bridger is by far superior, it is comfortable and although on paper is much heavier then a UL, you don't feel it. totally worth it! 
i am so convinced, i am selling my UL bags
review.name: worth it!

review.reviewBody:
Several years ago, I fractured a lower lumbar region bone and could not walk among other un desirable things...I was told my active days were done. "NO" I emphatically said. I would find a way, no matter how long it took. (I am  a 72 female, about 118 lbs, 5'6") Still not 100%, I rehabbed with a progressively  heavier pack daily for about 2 yrs and did a lot of exercises. 
I invested in an UL pack, thinking a light pack would help. No it abolutely  did not. All UL packs,  at least those I used, with their unstructured design, hung exactly on my painful part, making me cross.
Although this is not the lightest pack, my researched  contents are. So, this pack works well, distributing the load better, keeping content weight off fracture. It also has a zipper, opening my contents allowing me to either see or pack stuff. there is can internal frame and load lifters; the  2 chest straps really help me.The dedicated zippered area at the bottom for my sleeping system is very thoughtful, further increasing volume for packed stuff inside.
I would recommend this item to any one, especially to those with back issues; this pack seems to help me. It is pricey, but being able to long hike is priceless.
review.name: for "bad" backs

review.reviewBody: I use this pack for SAR and have found it to be comfortable and practical for my purposes. I would have given it 5 stars if it had the waist belt webbing to attach accessories like other models and as well a waterproof waist pocket is a must iso people can use it for cellphones.
review.name: Great pack but could be better!

review.reviewBody: This is the first backpacking pack I've purchased in over 20 years and I sure am happy with the decision.  I got fitted for the pack and was sized as an xs/s because I have a short torso.  The waist belt fit fine, despite the small size (I'm generally a women's size 8 or 8 Tall).  The pack's chest straps and pockets were a great feature.  Because of my short torso, I was able to put a small runner's water bottle in one of the pockets and access it with my mouth only--hands got to stay on my trekking poles.  It was very convenient.  The sleeping bag pocket is fairly small and required that I rethink what bag I was taking but that was only an issue because I believe in extra warm bags.  A footed sleeping quilt--10 degree--fit great, along with a small bag for my dog.  The body of the pack was a good size and the outside organizational loops and other pockets carried everything I needed.  Weirdly, for a 3 day trip, I had room to spare.  Very happy with the purchase and excited to put many more miles and adventures on it.
review.name: Great Pack!

name: Bridger 45L Backpack - Women's

review.reviewBody: I bought a Chris King headset on 7/5/2024. I accidentally ordered the wrong color. Figured it would be easy to exchange, how wrong I was. I received the part and called for a return label on 7/11/2024. Backcountry rep instructed me that without paying for an additional headset, they wouldn’t be able to ship the replacement until they received the original part. They received the returned part on 7/22/2024 but failed to remember to send the replacement back to me. I even called on 7/22/2024 to ensure they knew I didn’t want a refund and now was the time to send me my part. They were largely unaware that was supposed to happen, but ensured me my new part would be on the way, but oddly couldn’t provide me with a new tracking email. I should have realized he failed to complete his assignment or he would have been able to provide me with a new tracking email. After waiting another 10 days I decided to call again, thankfully, because they still didn’t remember to send my part. Maybe I will receive my part mid August. Who knows? Terrible customer service.
review.name: Wish I knew, still haven’t received part
comment: I’m sorry to hear about the frustrating experience you’ve had with your exchange and the delays in receiving your headset. We’ve emailed you to assist in resolving this situation.

review.reviewBody: I have been using CK headsets for over 20 years. Every other headset that I?ve tried, including FSA, and Cane Creek, end up either failing or at the very least creaking. CK headsets, since they?ve gone to the compression ring standard, have been absolutely silent and perfect.The vast majority of times I?ve isolated creeks coming from my bike it have been from headsets.The amount of time I have wasted chasing down creeks and pulling apart headsets would have easily been offset by the high price of a king headset.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got for the old ladies truck. Have used it many times now picnicking and such. Should buy another for my rig, compact size fits nicely in truck, would be handy during waterfowl season for dog.
review.name: Handy towel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super light and ACTUALLY dries you and itself quickly I love it so much I got another one and told others to get it. Only thing is I like their previous version it came in a netted bag but new version bag is like closed I prefer the netted one to help with airflow drying even more. But that’s the only minor con
review.name: Love this towel got another one

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a great little lightweight towel for carrying with you in any situation, not just outdoor activity where it really shines. Does the job to dry whatever you need. Lightweight and compact.
review.name: Nice towel

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been using these towels on international and cross country motorcycle trips for many years where compactness, durability, and function are imperative.
review.name: Works Great, Lightweight, Compact

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] for what i expected, to what i got, i’m pleased, so far. have not had a chance to use it, but will up-date, once i do.
review.name: quality product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great for taking on roadtrip in Rv. Doesn't take up much room, drys fast.
review.name: Use in my RV

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect towel for swim P.E. at school! So small, lightweight, sucks up the water, and dries before my kids come home from school. Bought 4 xl for each of my kids and they were worth every penny. Instead of a giant bulky towel to carry, they have a 4”*6” packet that weighs less than a pound wet. Best invention ever. A bunch of their friends immediately asked their parents for them.
review.name: Perfect for kids!!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've use this for drying my son after his swim lessons this winter and it was a lifesaver to get him nice and dry before we went out into the cold. I can't wait to use it this summer as well when we go camping. It absorbs so much liquid so quickly. He was dry so quickly!
review.name: Great towel!

review.reviewBody: I got this towel for its small size compared to the traditional type. It dries quickly and once dried, it packs away about the size of a CD case. Perfect!
review.name: Perfect For the Minimalist

review.reviewBody: The drylite towel has been my favorite since forever! I love the fabric, the quality and how quick it drys! I bought my first one at least 10 years ago and I wash it every time I use it and still in perfect condition. They last for decades!
review.name: The best towel!

name: DryLite Towel

review.reviewBody: Having found the item using a very specific Shimano part number needed due to the fact these are not universal fit I was very disappointed to receive the incorrect item.   The website description matched my specific item, however once I received the confirmation email for my order the new description was  completely different.
review.name: Not as described

review.reviewBody: the picture is what I needed.  it is not what I got.   that's on competitive cyclist.   the hoods I got came in a shimano box which listed the 20 or so levers that they would fit.  obviously a one size fits all replacement.  that's on Shimano.   if you want an exact replacement go to your LBS and see if they can get one for you.  I am going to try that sometime, maybe.   or, don't crash in the first place. the fit is a little loose around the top of the lever.  I am not going to bother putting the other one on as I know it won't fit right.
review.name: not as pictured

review.reviewBody: I've had several pairs of rain pants from other manufacturers over the years and these are the best so far.  They don't restrict my leg movements, don't leak, and are easy to get on and off.  The rise is high, so you have good overlap with your top and the waist drawstring seems sturdy enough, although I pair them with suspenders also.  Rain and wet brush are expected if you are outside much of the year here in the PNW, so you need some good rain pants.
review.name: Great rain pants!

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Trek Sleeping Bag: 15F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a wonderful sleeping bag to be used during cold temps. Handled single digits well. I used the reactor liner with this bag. I am very impressed with the quality and packability of this version. Would order again!
review.name: This is a wonderful sleeping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag was super easy to set up. Felt like I was in a cocoon throughout the night. Wish breathability was better. Idk how butterflies survive if thats what it feels like!
review.name: Hefty

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this sleeping bag. I am a side sleeper who likes their feet out. This bag meets these needs and goes with me everywhere I go. I sleep on my left side, the men's version is the way for me.
review.name: Side sleeper in sleep heaven

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very durable sleeping bag. It also helps keep your body temperature regulated so you’re not cold or super hot. I love the versatility of it and the packability of it.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is warm! It’s down filled. Can accommodate a person up to six feet. You can hook 2 sleeping bags together to make a double sleeper. Light weight. Not as constricting as some other mummy bags. Definitely a great find.
review.name: Warmth and comfort

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can't wait to use this camping! This is a very nice quality down sleeping bag. It's comfortable and roomy and is rated to keep you warm down to 15 degrees! The down didn't poke through the fabric and the zippers worked nicely. My only issue is that one of zippers seems to need fixed as noted in one of the pictures. I like that it came with both a storage cube so the down doesn't get deflated in storage but it also has a travel bag for your trips!
review.name: Good quality sleeping bag

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Super comfortable sleeping bag with a really good design to keep the zipper from breaking. Warm and more comfortable than most. Beautiful color and had multiple bag sizes to choose from.
review.name: Super comfy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The Sea to Summit Trek Down Sleeping Bag is really nice!  It’s super lightweight but keeps you warm!  The zippers are a little odd with them over lapping.  It comes with a nice bag to put it in to store away!
review.name: Great lightweight sleeping bag!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The package quality is next to none- the quality of the sleeping bag feels like a sleeping mat built into the sleeping bag.

Also comes with a user manual and a sleeping pouch container to hold the sleeping bag. 

Using it for last 1 month 

3 things that stood out 
1. Feels like I'm sleeping on a could, sleeping bag comes with a comfort padding and not just a bag with cheap/useless materials. 
2. Quality control is superb, company makes sure products are correct and very attention to detail. 
3. Overall the retention of heat is appearant and the product holds to its standard
review.name: Top of the line product that wont disappoint

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag is a dream! I'm so excited to use it while camping. Its so soft, extremely lightweight and super warm and comfortable. It has durable zippers and closures.  Opens from the top, side, AND bottom. Which is great for people like me who don't like their feet enclosed. I love down filled and knew right away I was going to fall in love with this sleeping bag. It even has a closure to tighten up around your enclosed head. Complete protection and warmth!
review.name: In love!

name: Trek Sleeping Bag: 15F Down

review.reviewBody: I’m a nurse, and bought them for work but I may keep them to wear around and buy a second pair for work.  I agree with other reviewers that they run about a 1/2 size large (I’m usually a 7.5 in sneakers and went with a 7 in these and they’re perfect).

Wry comfortable.
Design is great- nurses love the pattern in the back

review.reviewBody: These are one of the lightest shoes I’ve ever had! Very retro & stylish. They do seem like they’ll get dirty easily but that’s part of today’s ’effortless’ look. So maybe even as they get used they’ll still be cool? They feel breathable, but I haven’t used them long enough to really know whether your feet will stay fresh after multiple uses or if I’ll have to throw them in the washing machine for renewed freshness, but, so far, it feels like they are airy since they’re not like solid covering like leather (it’s more mesh throughout). Overall, satisfied.
review.name: Comfy & light

review.reviewBody: these are my third pair of new balance i love them, they fit perfect and are very comfortable

hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Dyna LT Hydration Pack - Women's online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] exactly what I was looking for! super lightweight and secure/doesn’t bounce. 10/10!
review.name: exactly what I was looking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really great lightweight vest! I was looking for something to hold all my things (phone, keys, inhaler, pepper spray, etc) and this best is perfect. The material makes it so that It doesn’t chafe when I run in only a sports bra, doesn’t hold in heat, and doesn’t seem to really get stinky. The straps have a lot of wiggle room to get the fit just right. I was between sizes so I sized up to be safe and I’m glad I did. I have the straps pulled almost all the way tight in the summer but I’ll have plenty of room to loosen for a winter jacket. The extra strap material was a bit annoying, so I tied it around itself a few times and problem solved. My only (minor) issue is when the water bottles get low, sometimes the soft flask will get suctioned against the mouthpiece so I have to squeeze the water up from the bottom to get the last little bit. Overall, fantastic vest & I’m very happy with my purchase!
review.name: Really great lightweight vest! I

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've used this vest for several 10+ mile runs. It holds everything I need to carry with no chaffing or bouncing. The straps adjust very easily. The flasks are super convenient and hold a good amount of water. I highly recommend this vest!
review.name: I've used this vest for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice vest! Lightweight! Unobtrusive. Good for day use.
review.name: Nice vest! Lightweight! Unobtrusive. Good

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] For long runs around town or in rural areas, this is an excellent vest! It holds just enough water and gels but doesn’t make me feel weighed down. I also appreciate the racer pack to help with cooling. However, as many others have noted, I am disappointed in the chest straps. I can’t seem to get a tight enough fit with the elastic material; I wish they were rigid cording instead.

I’m 5’7”, 153lbs, 34A bra and ordered a size medium. TBH I wish I had ordered a small as I really need to cinch the straps to get a good fit.
review.name: For long runs around town

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love the size and weight of this pack. Water bottles are a bit awkward to use. Great for cycling short distances.
review.name: Love the size and weight

review.reviewBody: I can’t believe it took me so long to purchase a running vest, but I’m so glad I bought this one. I am an avid long distance runner, who has tried the hydration belt and I hated how much it bounced around when I ran. The vest moves with me and is lightweight and sleek. I love all of the pockets it has for gels, keys, phone, etc. Highly recommend to any runner or hiker.
review.name: Favorite Running Accessory

review.reviewBody: I am an Osprey fan but a few things here missed the mark. Prior osprey packs had a magnet system for your bladder nozzle, this one doesn't. Why did they get rid of this function? So now you can tuck it in a pocket or bungee but not nearly as useful. Also, why isn't there a lock on the nozzle? If there is any pressure on the nozzle it immediately pours out water and soaks your shirt/pack.
review.name: A few design flaws

name: Dyna LT Hydration Pack - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fabulous boots! Warm, comfortable and so cute! I have bunions so I wasn’t sure whether to go with the regular fit or wide fit.  I went with regular and they fit just fine!  I ordered another pair in the purple color in wide so curious to see the difference!
review.name: Great Fit, Great Look, Warm & Cozy!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome!! Perfect what I am needing them for. I wish they were a little more water proof but will do.
review.name: Eeek :)

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] very light and warm to wear and the color is very pretty
review.name: Great quality!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these boots! Fit perfect, feel great, black looks good with everything. Its just started getting cold to really test them out!
review.name: Perfect boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can’t say enough good things bout these boots. I feared they would not give enough ankle support but they do! They are warm and lightweight which is just what I was looking for. They provide a lot of traction in the snow giving me confidence in my stride. I love them!
review.name: Perfect boots

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I got this for my sister who is moving to the Upper Midwest. I refuse to give her anything less than the best, and these boots are the best. They’re stylish, comfortable, warm, and waterproof. Her feet will not be cold!
review.name: Great Christmas Gift

review.reviewBody: Ame esta compra porque son cómodas al caminar cortas y largas distancias, te ayudan a proteger del frío extremo y lluvia fuerte.
review.name: Best shoes for fall and winter

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I brought these boots for my wife. She loves the overall look of the boots. The nice fit she feels when she puts them on. Loves that she does not have to wear two pairs of socks to stay warm. She came in the room hollering, and they are waterproof. I replied, glad you are happy with them....
review.name: WIFE LOVES THEM

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased these in black, with the black soles and greyish black “fur”. These winter boots are soft inside and super cozy. These keep my feet toasty warm, and keep the snow at bay on cold fall and winter days. They are a perfect fit because they are not loose, but are also not too tight in the leg area. It feels like a gentle hug on the legs when wearing, which helps keep the cold and wet out, and the heat and dry in. I love that there are no shoe laces to tie each too. Another great product from Columbia!
review.name: Soft & Cozy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Comfortable and warm, everything i need in a snow boot.
review.name: Comfortable and warm

name: Minx IV Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I am huge on word of mouth and heard from so many people these are a great do it all shoe for trail and long distance. They are lightweight, breathable, so comfortable out of the box, I ran a few miles my first day on them and noticed there is no break in period. I love the elastic band to keep the laces secure and the FlipRelease truly is great. I kept mine unlocked but can see great benefit to keeping it locked! I had to get my mom a pair! I have an average arch and wear 7.5 in Merrell and Salomon. I got a 7.5 in these and they were a great fit. 10 / 10 recommend. 

#BackcountryGearhead
review.name: Worth the hype!

name: Cloudultra 2 Shoe - Women's

description: Buy the Jetboil HalfGen Base Camp Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: HalfGen Base Camp Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Jetboil HalfGen Base Camp Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: It works amazingly, especially as a glamping-style setup, whether as a stand-alone unit or as a companion to the Genesis Basecamp setup. It has solid, consistent heating and even cooking flow. It also has easy ignition.
review.name: Awesome as a stand alone or companion to the Jetboil Genesis Basecamp

review.reviewBody: This is an essential piece of camp gear! Easy to pack, although somewhat heavy. Works great and lights even in the toughest of winds.
review.name: Essential Camp Tool!

review.reviewBody: Not usually a drive-in camper but with a few friends coming to town I needed a way to cook for 4 while taking in the sights instead of just boiling water for backpacking meals. I would describe it as: a way to have 90% of a classic camping stove in 1/4 the bulk. It's not a backpacking stove, and it's not a massive 3 burner cooktop, but it perfectly fits the niche in-between. It's nice and compact for its class, the piezoelectric igniter is great, and the pan is large enough to be useful for actual cooking of basic meals. If you're cooking breakfast + coffee you may want to consider taking either a classic jetboil in addition, or the apollo add-on. I intend to get the apollo add-on for coffeemaking purposes before my next trip
review.name: Burner for car camping kitchen

review.reviewBody: Excellent purchase, use it everyday on the patio to cook.
review.name: Excellent

review.reviewBody:
Pros: Compact, easy to use, and fits in my camping gear bin.  I’ve primarily used this piece of gear for camping - boiling water, pancakes, and quesadillas. I’m still working on simmer control for making such things as pancakes. I wish I would have purchased the two burner set. 
Cons: Bottom of pan gets easily scratched on campground tables, which appears mostly aesthetic for now as it doesn’t appear to impact cooking performance. Windscreen that came with stove seems a bit flimsy and possible clumsy, but I have not used it yet - mostly for those reasons.
review.name: Overall, a great compact stove set-up!

review.reviewBody:
I love it! simple to use and clean.
Great car camping kitchen stove.
review.name: best addition to the car camp set up!!

review.reviewBody: It's capable and efficient.  A well thought out form factor especially with the Jetboil accessories although any pot or pan will work just fine.  The simmer control is great when you want to cook stew or rice but can still boil a pot of water fast.  Easy to clean and the lighter works.
review.name: Best burner out there

review.reviewBody: This is a fantastic little stove. It's small size makes it a viable option for both solo camping and family camping. It is a little on the heavy side for a trail camping pack but is doable. This burner worked excellently for a weekend getaway with the family and takes up very little space considering. If you want a do it all cooking option this is not the worst choice you could make. If you plan to only camp out of the back of your vehicle the Full Gen may be an even better option. Either way I love this item and it serves its purpose well.
review.name: Compact convenience

review.reviewBody: I do not recommend this product. My wife and I used the HalfGen for about 2 years and initially we were out camping and the regulator broke leaving us without a stove. I contacted Jetboil and they sent me another regulator. On our last trip the regulator again malfunctioned however this time flames came out of the top of the regulator melting the plastic on our tacoma. I contacted Jetboil and they offered to give us ANOTHER new regulator #3 but we have decided to try another more reliable product instead. I do not feel safe using the HalfGen and do not recommend this product.
review.name: Faulty regulator left us stranded X2

review.reviewBody:
This is the first camp stove I’ve ever bought that I can actually control the flame.  Most are either off or full blast.  The pan so far is very good, heats mostly evenly.  The pan cleans easy because of the nonstick that is actually nonstick.
The bad,  one of the rubber straps broke 2nd use.  I would like a bigger spread on the flame so the heat is more even across the entire pan.  I would like the ability to use the same canisters as the smaller jetboils so I only need to carry one fuel. If that is not possible, then the output port should have a compatible hose to hook up to the smaller jetboils.
review.name: Almost excellent

name: HalfGen Base Camp Stove
HalfGen Base Camp Stove
