review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This plate worked ok. It still gets hot on the bottom if you put something like baked beans on it. It worked really good for like hamburgers or potato salad. It was very sturdy. It did still kind of move even though there is no skid on the bottom but not to bad.
review.name: Very sturdy

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Received this product complimentary from Influenster in exchange for my honest review. I’m a sucker for stainless steel plates and container. We typically used them because they are more durable and it keeps our food fresher. I love this because it sort of a plate and bowl combined. I love that my items can stay on there nice and secured. The style of the stainless steel is so cute to me. I love this and want more items from this brand! 10/10
review.name: So durable and cute!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This plate is a game-changer for outdoor adventures! It's durable, lightweight, and perfect for meals around the campfire. I love how easy it is to clean, and its compact size makes it ideal for packing. Plus, the stainless steel construction means it can handle whatever rugged terrain I encounter. It's become an essential part of my camping gear!
review.name: Essential for camping!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sea to Summit Detour Stainless Steel Plate is constructed from a polished stainless steel. It has a durable design with thick and smooth surface. Has been very easy to care for, clean and store. I can imagine many useful things to use this Detour plate for beyond using for just a plate.
The rubberized grip, on the bottom, allows for sturdy staying when placing with absolutely no slippage. I think it has been a great addition to my home that I will use for different reasons.
review.name: Highly useful

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Medium sized steel plate with a rubber base at the bottom making it easy to handle. It is lightweight. I have not tested it in the dishwasher so not sure whether it is dishwasher safe. Quality looks okay (not high quality for sure). I'm going to use it as breakfast plate.
review.name: Medium sized steel plate

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This stainless steel plate is perfect for on the go camping adventures. It is lightweight and very well designed with its rubber bottom for non slipping and heat resistant silicone for using around camp fires. This is a plate if well taken care off can last a long time
review.name: Great design

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This Detour Stainless Steel Plate is the perfect size. It’s super easy to clean, food doesn’t stick to it. I can use it to cook with then eat right out of it. It’s definitely an on the road item I bring.
review.name: Super versatile

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a very handy plate. It is stainless steel with a rubber ring on the back so that it is slip resistant. Great for camping or use in a camper. Easy to clean up too.
review.name: Great plate

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This stainless steel plate is lightweight and durable. It can be used for many applications and it’s easy to clean. The size is just right and the silicone base is perfect to prevent slipping on smooth surfaces.
review.name: Sleek and multi functional!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Curve between the base and sidewalls perfectly allow for less mess meals. Designed to stack, the silicone rubber insert in the base means the plates will not slide or rattle during transport
review.name: Ideal for hungry campers!!

name: Detour Stainless Steel Plate

description: Buy the Thule Subterra 30in Rolling Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Subterra 30in Rolling Gear Bag
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Subterra 30in Rolling Gear Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I researched for months after my bag that I traveled the world with finally dead after +20 years.  This bag does everything that bag did plus way more.  I needed a duffle bag a hard storage area under it.  I have taken this bag on at least 8 trips and even though it is black I can spot the Thule label.  The team at Thule really thought this bag out, especially with the clips that secure the bottom to the top. I am expecting this bag to last at least another 20 years.  First time purchaser life long respect now.
review.name: Amazing bag

review.reviewBody: Haven’t used the bag yet, but looking forward to using this bag.  One disappointing aspec of this bag is that there are no hold down straps in either compartment.  Nothing to hold your clothes in place.
review.name: Good quality and construction

review.reviewBody: Have yet to travel with this bag but will be going on a 6 week trip to Mexico in a couple weeks. Love how modular this bag is and the robustness of the zippers. Having only messed around with it in my house I am not sure how sold I am on the compartment that zips all the way through both parts of the bag BUT am excited to see how that works out when I am actually traveling.
review.name: Love the features

review.reviewBody: When I first saw it in person, I was a little disappointed, because It appears small/compact. Don't get fooled by its looks, you are able to store more than you can think! Its lightweight, compact, the orange inside its amazing for you to be able to locate clothes, or stuff easily like money, keys, in case they get lost, or a lotion. The wheels are big, and they look like they can get take a good beating. My only complaint is that it takes time for you to get used to its shape. It's basically 2 bags that gets fused together via a zipper, but after that and be able to use the cords it's a true blessing because it can help as a divider. You can use it to store different kind of stuff or use one bag for you and the other one for your partner.
review.name: It takes time to get used to.

review.reviewBody: Purchased both the 30" and the 22" bags for a 2-week 2-person trip to Portugal and these bags were everything I hoped they would be. They held up well during frequent transfers, rolled great over some rough cobbled streets, and were easy to keep organized. The big bag was a LOT to carry up/down the narrow staircases of Lisbon and I wish the side handle had some more padding, but otherwise these bags are just about perfect. Note there are not really any internal or external pockets, so packing cubes are essential to keeping them organized.
review.name: Awesome bags

review.reviewBody: I love this bag so much. When I go on ski trips, I can fit all my gear into the bottom section (boots, helmet, ski pants and jacket, etc.), and then all my casual clothing and toiletries in the top. If I travel for a weekend with my husband and toddler, we can easily pack for all of us!
review.name: I use this for every type of travel!

review.reviewBody: Haven’t used it yet traveling overseas in May. Excited to use though after my Thule Rooftop Cargo carriers I’ve used in the past
review.name: Subterra 2-1 30”

review.reviewBody: Just bought this bag and am really impressed with both the appearance and quality of materials. The bag is very durable, versatile and has plenty of space for everything you need while travelling.
review.name: Excellent Quality!

review.reviewBody: Super durable and I love how I can unzip the 2 compartments and check them separately.
review.name: Durable and Convenient

review.reviewBody: As a serious hobbyist nature photographer I need a wheeled duffel that can store both clothing and gear (excluding my cameras). I had an older Mountainsmith duffel with a zippered bottom compartment that served me well but finally succumbed to the airline luggage environment. This Thule two piece duffel is an excellent replacement. Having the ability to remove the top completely is a game changer. It gives me the ability to rummage through both pieces side by side as I prep for the days adventure. The handle is well designed and the empty weight allows me to add a few more pieces of gear without going over weight limits. Now if Thule would make one with a 32 Inch length, my larger tripod would be able to come along on trips.
review.name: Great design for travel

name: Subterra 30in Rolling Gear Bag

description: Buy the Anker Solix PS400 400W Portable Solar Panel online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Solix PS400 400W Portable Solar Panel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Anker Solix PS400 400W Portable Solar Panel online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Works great got up to 300 watts at 2 o'clock sun with my other panel will get a full charge in one day
review.name: Works great got up to

review.reviewBody: The Anker 400watt solar panels arrived in good condition. I use them to charge my F3800 power station. I am very pleased with the performance of the solar panels and the F3800.
review.name: Anker 400watt solar panel

review.reviewBody: The Anker Solix 400W Solar Panel is built like a tank. Like the rest of the Anker product line, you'll be able to hand this product off to your kids and grandkids. It's extremely well made. The only downside is that it's heavy. That being said, there is a lot of weight there to help fight the wind. Thumbs up.
review.name: The Anker Solix 400W Solar Panel is built like a tank

review.reviewBody:
After countless hours of research and watching YouTube videos, I decided to purchase the F2600 power station & the PS400 solar panel.
The F2600 is the most recent iteration of the F2000, which in its own rights is a great product. Adding WiFi & simultaneous charging are a couple of the latest refinements.
It's size is interesting as it falls in-between size groups but it competes quite well with the larger units. Size is perhaps one of the most notable and beneficial attributes. It has such great portability yet still possessing the ability to power all your most critical devices during a power outage makes this a great choice. Everyone has different needs, but you would be hard pressed not to put this unit near the top of your list.
This thing is truly a beast and the quality is second to none.
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: Impressed with how solid these panels feel. Gives me confidence in using them. Setup was easy and pair well with my 767. Having the adjustable stands is nice. This time of year the panels need to be around 46 degrees so having the built in flexible stands makes this usable year round. I’ll probably purchase a second set since the 767 can handle it.
review.name: Sturdy panels

review.reviewBody: Totally satisfied! Purchased 2 Anker SOLIX PS400 Solar Panels (400W) and they perform as advertised. They are also easy to set and connect.
review.name: Totally satisfied!

review.reviewBody: Panels function well, getting 720 watts delivered with two panels. Panels are heavy and my only dislike is that the panel set up is not sturdy. Folding arms are flimsy and I fear they will blow over in any amount of wind.
review.name: Anker PS400 Panels

review.reviewBody: I loved everything about it except it is too heavy. My spouse would not be able to set by herself. I wonder if I could have purchased 2 of 200W.
review.name: Amazing, but beware it's heavy.

name: Solix PS400 400W Portable Solar Panel

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pants. I'd like to get them in gray or black.
review.name: More colors please!

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: As advertised, definitely worth the purchase.  Very lightweight and elastic/stretchable, very soft and comfortable feeling, and very durable when using outdoors clearing blackberries, and a good stain guard.  Love the pants, very versatile for many occasions, whether indoors or outdoors, rain or shine, or just lounging, and compresses easily in a bag for travel.
review.name: Force Sun Defender Lightweight Relaxed Fit Pant

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Very comfortable work pant. Do they make a winter pant out of the same material like a fleece lined set of these?
review.name: Winter version

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Super comfortable. Nice for travel.   Wash up wrinkle free!
review.name: Carhartt pants

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Work well for humid days in Mississippi but man I wish they had some more colors. I would also buy sunforce longsleeve shirts if they didn't have the giant logo on the sleeve, just saying
review.name: Great pants for hot weather need more colors

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Keeps you cool and are lightweight would recommend for hot working conditions where pants are required

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Their very light and comfortable l like them alot!..

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Legs could be wider on bottom to allow to wear with boots

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm a rough carpenter in south Florida. The pants are great! My only complain would be the relaxed fit. Very baggy on the bottom. If they made a slim option would be much better. My pants tend to get stuck on straps when I walk on the tie-beam. I also use them for fishing.
review.name: Rough carpenter

review.itemreviewed: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm 6' 170lbs and purchased small tall pants and they fit perfect. Wore them for three days cutting  black locust trees down and they still look brand new. Temps were in the high 90s all three days and never thought about my legs getting hot or sweaty. Pants are phenomenal
review.name: Please don't stop making these!

name: Force Sun Defender Relaxed Fit Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I had been looking for a pair of zip off hiking pants that didn’t zip off into Bermuda-length shorts. These are the ones!! I love the fabric and the fit is great. My only complaint is that the waistband is a bit smaller than what the size chart says, and it does not have any stretch. My waist is about 27 inches and I ordered a size 4. I also think the quality is great for the price.
review.name: Great pants!

review.reviewBody: I ordered a 12 the only size that was available, I am usually a 8 or 10. The 12 doesnt even fit, the waist is too small.
review.name: Sizing is way too small

review.reviewBody: I ordered the wander shorts and pants in 6 and 8 (I'm usually a 4). In both cases, I preferred sizing up once for a slimmer fit. For a loose fit, size up twice.
review.name: Great but size up once or twice

review.reviewBody: Love these pants! I’m 5”8’ and they’re the perfect length. Ive used them for climbing and biking and the zip-off feature is great for when I get warm. I’m normally a size 8 but had to exchange for a size 10.
review.name: Runs small

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a size 8 or 10. I ordered the 10 since the 12 was not available. They fit very nicely except for the waist. To be comfortable I like a waist size of 29 or 30. These at their most stretched-out-ness are probably a size 28 waist. That's stretched. I am going to keep them to motivate me to slim down.
review.name: It's True - Runs Small

review.reviewBody:
Bought these for a long trek in the Dolomites! Was hoping to wear them more as shorts but the weather had other plans!

I’m usually a size 2-4 (26) but I returned the size 4 in these for a size 6. Even that was a biiiit snug in the waist so definitely size up

I liked the pockets and the short length was cute! Not too too short but a bit shorter than other zip offs i looked at. The color was fun and unique and they held up well in snow, ice and mud. Easy to zip on and off even for a quick trail side adjustment. 

Would recommend!!
review.name: Run small but cute fit

review.reviewBody: These are my new favorite pants to climb in! They're super comfortable and durable, I am a flexible climber and I had no issues stretching in these. They zip off to make the perfect length short too. I got them in 2 colors and would honestly get more. I also love the little detail on the back pocket.
review.name: Comfortable, durable, and cute!

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like these but the sizing just didn't work for me. The waist was a bit too tight but the length of the legs was too short, and there was excess fabric in the legs. I could have made them work, but they just weren't comfortable or flattering. I returned them before using and will continue my search for zip off pants elsewhere!
review.name: I wanted to like these

review.reviewBody: Wore these pants on a moderately difficult hike. They worked well. I like the length of the shorts when the leg pieces are off. A little more feminine than other hiking shorts. I would recommend sizing up. I’m usually a size 8 in most things but these were super tight. These are high waisted. I wish also they had some zippers on the pockets.
review.name: Short length perfect.

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my Colorado hiking trip and they were the perfect pant. It was cool in the morning then as I hiked and it got warmer, I unzipped the pants to make shorts. I’m so glad I purchased these.
review.name: The Perfect Pant

name: Wander Zip-Off Pant - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Recon Pro Stretch Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Both zippers failed on the first pair I got and they eventually sent me a new pair with a different zipper only on the right leg (which is weird). This new zipper lasted one season but the first time I touched it in the second season it self destructed like the first pair did. I am just super disappointed with this failure since I trust my life to BD gear on a regular basis. Now I find myself looking at my draws and hoping they don't have the same people putting them together. . .
review.name: Really Disappointing Knee Pocket Zippers

review.itemreviewed: Recon Pro Stretch Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I’m 5’7 155lbs 30” inseam and the small fits perfect. Most bibs the shoulder straps won’t synch down all the way but these do perfectly and with room to spare. These have the right amount of stretch in all the right places and the side vents are plenty big enough so you won’t over heat on long treks
review.name: Perfect fit

review.itemreviewed: Recon Pro Stretch Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Best bibs, hands down. Perfect amount of stretch and right amount of storage as well. Nailed it
review.name: Bomber

review.itemreviewed: Recon Pro Stretch Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Love these bibs but man, the kick guard area is just shredded after 8 days...  To the touch it seems like a solid heavier weight panel, but compared to two tears after 10 years in my previous ski pants I'm guessing the fabric may not really be a kevlar type panel.  Not about to change how I ski, so I guess I'll have to add a proper patch...

great fit on the large - 5-11, 195lbs - plenty of room for a layer and the stretch fabric is outstanding.
review.name: Bibs - 5 star - Kick Guard - 0 Star

review.itemreviewed: Recon Pro Stretch Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really nice soft shell bibs. Spot for a ‘beacon’ in the right thigh pocket that comes with a removable tether. Chest pockets are nice with an internal pocket on the left side. (It would be nice to have them in every pocket) I might have gone down a size knowing now how the overalls sag a bit but they actually fit very nice.
review.name: Great bibs.

review.itemreviewed: Recon Pro Stretch Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: The product is very well made. It looks very durable, the closures are good. For my part, I took a size Large, I'm 1m83 in terms of leg length it corresponds but in terms of waist size it's a little too big for me
review.name: Good product

review.itemreviewed: Recon Pro Stretch Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was kind of bummed by the plastic holder but the ajustment is real nice and they are really comfortable. The pockets are also well placed.
review.name: Real well made

review.itemreviewed: Recon Pro Stretch Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Im in between L and XL… XL bib has enough maneuverability to shorten it up, or fit taller people. 

Super warm. Durable and flexible. Plenty of access and to under layers and deep chest pockets. It’ll get some good mountain time tomorrow and the next couple days to follow… 

So far, everything you’d expect with the quality and dependability of Black Diamond
review.name: In between sizes

review.itemreviewed: Recon Pro Stretch Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have been disappointed by the quality of some gear lately, but not what I'm getting from Black Diamond. Their gear, and especially the Recon Stretch Pro Bibs, feel like I'm wearing something designed and fabricated for climbing Everest.
review.name: Recon Pro Bibs - The Bomb

review.itemreviewed: Recon Pro Stretch Bib Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: The recon stretch PRO medium fits me perfect. The regular (non pro) recon stretch in medium is noticeably smaller for some reason, and was too snug in the chest. This is perfect. I’m 5’10 170 lbs
review.name: Fits better than the non pro version

review.reviewBody:
The drive side would fit halfway, then it would get too tight so I stopped. The non drive side would not screw in at all. I hand tight both sides, and it just would not screw in. Upon close inspection of the threads, you can clearly see the threads isn't lined up correctly. 

I can't believe this passed quality control. Something so important and can potentially ruin a bike frame should be closely inspected. Lesson learned, never buying Chris King products again.
review.name: Almost Ruined My Bike Frame.

hasVariant.name: Tera Polarized Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sunski Tera Polarized Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love, love, LOVE the colors, style, lenses, and construction of these glasses. My SINGLE complaint is that I’m a petite gal with a not huge head and they are a bit large. The saving grace is that the nose bridge and arms have grippers on them. By no means do the glasses move or fall down while I’m active, but, it would still be nice if companies considered that glasses are not one size fits all.
review.name: Almost Perfect!

review.reviewBody: This is actually the fourth pair of Sunski sunglasses I have purchased. I gave the first pair I bought to a friend in Egypt because he loved them. My friend's dog ate my second pair after I had them for only one day when I stopped by for a visit and put them on the table. My third pair are doing ok, even though I sat on them and slightly bent the frame out of balance, which I fixed with a little twisting. I bought this later pair because I'm heading back to Egypt next week for three months and I want to make sure that is something happens to my current pair, I'll have a spare on hand. I love these glasses.
review.name: My 4th pair of Sunski sunglasses.

review.reviewBody: Great quality. Silicone grip on the nose makes it not slide down your face.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: I got the tortoise Tera with the indigo blue lenses & they’re my favorite pair of sunglasses yet! Sunski consistently makes the best sunglasses in my opinion, & I’m stoked to have these for late winter & early spring adventures when things are super bright here in AK. It’s hard to find sunglasses that aren’t super expensive but that protect your eyes from the sun, snow glare, & aren’t over the top in their design. The Tera balance a straightforward everyday-wear design, but with a solid frame that won’t get beat up, & the bonus of the peripheral protection, which is especially great to have during snow activities. Very excited to wear these while flying, skiing, biking, & playing outside all spring, & popping the flaps off for regular wear all summer!
review.name: Excellent as always!

review.reviewBody: These sunglasses have been the perfect accessory for my adventuring. I wore my first pair to climb Kilimanjaro and hike various national parks throughout North America. Then I replaced them and adventured through Antarctica with them. I cannot say enough about how great these sunglasses are. Absolutely love them!
review.name: Adventuring So Hard

review.reviewBody: Very lightweight, comfortable, stylish frames--the shields have little magnets to keep them in place, such thoughtful design! The fit is good, but I prefer a larger frame sunglass for sun safety, these are a bit narrower than I usually wear. I hope Sunski one day releases a higher profile frame with side shields, and a bonus if they consider some bolder, non-neutral colors.
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody:
These seem like high quality sunglasses and I like the style, however the back-glare is really bad. I would expect the side shields to prevent the glare, which is why I purchased these, but I can see a reflection of my face when I wear these in bright sunlight and it gives me a headache.

I tried to go for a run in these and when the sun was directly in my face I couldn’t see at all due to the glare. 

 I would not recommend these if you have a smaller face shape because I think the fit issue causes the glare. That being said, the side shields seem really nice and I like the magnetic mechanism.
review.name: back glare despite side shields
comment: We sent you an email to help you out!

review.reviewBody: Searching forever for glasses that help with bright sun in Florida
review.name: So much better

review.reviewBody: Great packaging and presentation. Nice case.  Great fit. Initial impression was awesome and can’t wait to use on the Mtn!  Thx!
review.name: Excited for These Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I love these glasses! I use them as a wildland firefighter. The sunshields helped keep wood chips out of my eyes while running the chainsaw. Very comfortable on my face and feels like a quality, well made product. Highly reccomend!
review.name: The best sunglasses for wildland firefighting!

review.reviewBody: Saw a co worker wearing the and loved the look. Super cute and comfortable. Definitely plan on buying different colors. 11/10 would buy again!
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I wear them all day teaching on my feet, and they are like walking on clouds!
review.name: These are the most comfortable shoes that I have ever had.

review.reviewBody: The straps are a bit stiff and where are they connect is hurting my feet.
review.name: Stiff product

review.reviewBody: These shoes are so cute and comfortable. I love that they dress up and down so easy. the fit great and feel very secure on my feet. I wore them for air travel and did not mind having them on all day. I just got the brown ones. I hope they make them in more colors, they look good with everything and I get a lot of compliments.
review.name: I hope they make more colors

review.reviewBody: So bummed! I really liked these and got a lot of compliments. However after a couple months the sole is separating from the front. Really bummed =(
review.name: Sole separated after a couple months

review.reviewBody: Let me start by saying I do love these shoes- they are comfy, easy to slip on and off, and they feel good on my feet. I've had them for a few weeks now and the straps are fraying like crazy. I work a 9-5 office job which I wear them to, so it's not like I'm putting them through the wringer or anything. I try to leave them alone if it's not a lot (which sometimes it is) but it makes them look old already!
review.name: Wish The Quality Was Better

review.reviewBody: I have so much to say about these awesome shoes! Wow! SO cute, yet still totally comfortable and functional. I am getting another pair in black because I haven't taken these off since I bought them! My feet are problematic. They are very wide and I have a bunion on my right foot. It is really hard for me to find ANY shoe that fits me comfortably, let alone an online purchase. These shoes blew my mind! The straps adjust to fit my unique foot shape and they do NOT rub or bother my feet in a weird way. I have put these shoes to the MAX! I got them in the mail, put them on and then immediately headed to a week long festival. I wore them the entire week. I walked up to four miles a day and stood on my feet for extended periods... even a couple 12 hour days. Everything hurt on my body except for my feet. They looked cute with every outfit... skits, shorts, pants. It was so fun feeling like I could wear cute shoes at a festival and not have to sacrifice the health of my feet. Thank you Teva for creating a shoe like this! It is my "go to" shoe for all things summer!
review.name: I AM IN LOVE WITH THESE SHOES!!!!

review.reviewBody: These are super comfortable and stylish. I can dress them up with a cute sundress or down with Jeans and Tee. I originally bought them in a size 10, like my other Tevas, but I had to size down to a 9 for this style.
review.name: Stylish & Comfortable

review.reviewBody: This is a really fun and stylish shoe,very comfortable! There is one huge caveat,the rubber sole keeps separating at the toe. I've communicated with Teva and because I purcthese at a shoe store and the 30 return policy has ended my only recourse is to send them to Teva for evaluation!! This leaves me without these shoes for the duration of time this takes. Needless to say I'm very disappointed with Teva's customer service!
review.name: Great shoe....but!

review.reviewBody: Hi! I bought the cream and brown pair of these after I bought the black pair...I didn't realize they changed the style and none of them are "leather" anymore. However, this change also came with irritating fabric for the straps which has been causing me blisters when I wear these shoes for even an hour. Whereas the black ones I bought months ago I wear day in and day out with no issue. I would not recommend these shoes at all, cause even adjusting the straps doesn't help. Either they irritate the small muscle in the side of my foot or they cause blisters.
review.name: Giving me blisters, not wearable for me

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It’s a beautiful coat (much prettier than it shows in these photos)—just thin, and would be more of a fall than a winter piece.
review.name: Beautiful coat

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this jacket!  The length and curved hemline are perfect and flattering. The fabric is smooth but not slippery. The warmth is there without being suffocating and I can wear layers under it for visiting family that live in colder climates. Very well made. Nice to have a light colored jacket but not have to worry about it getting too dirty by simply brushing up against the car. Love the two tone. I am a traveling Memaw and have lots of grandchildren to chase after. I’m 5’5 and 150lbs and ordered a large.
review.name: Perfect

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The down insulation provides exceptional warmth without the bulk, making it lightweight and comfortable for all-day wear. Its mid-length design offers extra coverage against the cold, while the sleek, tailored fit adds a flattering, stylish look. The durable outer material is wind-resistant and water-repellent, perfect for unpredictable winter weather.

Whether you're exploring the outdoors or navigating city streets, this jacket delivers on comfort, quality, and style. A must-have for staying cozy in colder months!
review.name: the perfect blend of warmth and functionality

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love it!!! The colors , the fitting everything was just right!
review.name: Love it!

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered both a medium and large. Large based on the recommendation posted. However, this does not take into consideration, your body figure. I have a much smaller waist / upper body than my lower. The large was bulky all over the stomach and arms but fit perfectly on my lower half. The medium was perfect everywhere but my bottom half. If you have a pear / apple size figure, I would not recommend this jacket. Otherwise, it’s adorable and very warm! Sad I have to return both.
review.name: Wish it worked out!

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this coat , i was tired of being cold but didn't like the average black puffers, this one is lovely warm and just long enough
review.name: Long and lovely

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] EVERYTHING I WAS LOOKING FOR IN A WINTER JACKET.  COMFORTABLE, COZY AND WARM!!
review.name: GREAT JACKET

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought this jacket for a trip to Iceland. Was very packable and warm!!! My mom and sister like my coat so much the purchased the same coat!
review.name: Perfect for Iceland

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Exceeded all my expectations. I'm over the moon thrilled with my new coat. It's perfect, travelling to NYC not using the coat in below zero temperature. Trust me, The pictures don't do justice how beautiful in person took my breath away. Gift yourself, or family members. In the process losing weight normally xl now large fits with room to layer.
Love the coat so much next year buy smaller size, and donate this one. Thanks! Columbia, You have outdone yourself.
review.name: Gorgeous Coat

review.itemreviewed: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Beautiful jacket, fits well. It was purchased to replace a 800 fill power jacket and I'm a little worried it won't be warm enough this winter.  But, Columbia doesn't seem to have warmer jackets for women this year.
review.name: Beautiful Colors

name: Mountain Croo III Mid Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Excelente gata para darle a la placa o usar en el gym. No es demasiado agresiva pero no por eso carece de buena precisión.
review.name: Gran calzado

review.reviewBody: I’m a somewhat experienced climber, but these are the first climbing shoes I’ve bought. After hearing and researching how climbing shoes should fit and how fit varies between companies, I decided to buy a size smaller than my street shoes. Two pairs later I ended up with the same size or a half size bigger than my street shoes. They were still a little tight, but have stretched a little over a few weeks since I got them and feel good now.
review.name: Good shoes

review.reviewBody: I had originally ordered these shoes the same size as the La Sportiva Finales that I currently use, thinking they would fit similarly. However, I could not fit my foot in the shoe. Fine, I should have tried these shoes on at a store first. But then I ordered them in a full size (European size) larger, and could definitely get my foot inside, but my toes felt a bit crunched and fairly horizontally bunched up. I could deal with the crunching if the shoe were to expand and because the straps would allow for easy removal. I just can't deal with the narrowness of it. I didn't really see this being discussed in other reviews/product description so thought I should let other people with wide feet know. For what it's worth, these shoes look great and fit well everywhere other than the toe-box . . .
review.name: Wanted to Like These

review.reviewBody: These are a bit softer than I'd like.  They are certainly not as soft as the Veloces.  Compared to the Vapor V, these are a little less comfortable but seems to form to your feet slightly better. I have not compared these to the Quantic.  I would consider these a good step up from beginner shoes (like V3-V5 bouldering)
review.name: Good shoes

name: Quantix SF Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I'm 6'0" and I found the sleeves too short. There no way to seal them at the cuff because the elastic cuff isn't tight. Would be better better if the sleeves were a bit longer; I like Patagonia in this respect. Would be perfect except for the sleeve length.

review.reviewBody: Man people can be so picky, based some of the other reviews here.  This is meant to be a: ultralight no-frills high quality down jacket.  No it doesn't have a cell phone pocket.  No it doesn't have three adjustment cords.  Color options are limited.  The brand isn't stitched into the breast for everyone to admire. review.reviewBody: Lightweight and awesome. I wil use it under my other TR mat to keep me off the ground
review.name: Lightweight and awesome. I wil

review.reviewBody: Great pad, comfortable on its own, in colder conditions I use it in conjunction with an xlite performs flawlessly!
review.name: Bomber pad!

review.reviewBody: So light and adds cushion to any sleeping situation!
review.name: So light and adds cushion

review.reviewBody: Super lightweight, setup and teardown is very fast. You will want additional insulation in the winter, but for fall through summer it is sufficient on its own.
review.name: Worth the money.

review.reviewBody: This is my third one of these in the last few years. I use it when I'm trying to go light but this new one is for extra insulation this winter. They are just easy to use and pack up which is important with cold fingers! I wish Cascade Designs would make a version that is 25 inches wide. For those of us that sled pack in winter the extra width wouldn't be a problem like it might be on a pack.
review.name: This is my third one

review.reviewBody:
This pad is great, lightweight and does the job it's intended to do. Don't expect this pad to give the same comfort or insulation as an inflatable pad it's not made to compete with them. It's in a class of its own, very affordable, lightweight and worry free since it is not inflatable. Probably not the best option for quilt systems or cold environments. Design is best for above 40°.
 This is the KISS of sleeping pads.
review.name: This pad is great, lightweight

review.reviewBody: This is a great foam pad. I typically use this on shorter hikes to limit the gear that I have to carry on longer distances. However, I commonly use this to layer up my sleeping pads when winter camping or to make my sleeping experience that much comfier when car camping. It is also super great as a door mat during winter camping as it helped to not track snow into the main area of the tent. I will definitely be getting the Z Seat given my experience with the pad!
review.name: Very versatile pad

review.reviewBody: I think what surprised me the most is how well I slept on this pad. It is light weight and compactable enough to fit in the original box where it packs to the original size. Even better, I used the opportunity to sleep on at the first night and I was extraordinarily delighted both the first time and every time afterward.
review.name: I think what surprised me

review.reviewBody: I cut it in half and use it as a pad to sit on while glassing. It's very light weight and comfortable.
review.name: Other use

review.reviewBody: Best foam pad on the market. I wish that you could order it in a size long though.
review.name: Best foam pad on the

name: Z Lite Sleeping Pad

review.itemreviewed: MW Synthetic-Wool Blend Boot Sock - 2-Pack - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've been using this brand and style of sock for about two years. found them very comfortable and warm. altho they are not the thick wool sock they do keep my feet warm and have a good bit of cush to them. 
Very happy and plan on ordering more.

review.itemreviewed: MW Synthetic-Wool Blend Boot Sock - 2-Pack - Men's
review.reviewBody: Hands down the best work sock ive used. I get a solid 2 years out of them in timberland pro boondocks. Just enough padding, just enough warmth. I wear them year round. Work in precast concrete, indoors and outdoors.

review.itemreviewed: MW Synthetic-Wool Blend Boot Sock - 2-Pack - Men's
review.reviewBody: They look good but they fit way too tight. My same size old carhartt socks used to fit better. I take them off and put on my old ones.

review.itemreviewed: MW Synthetic-Wool Blend Boot Sock - 2-Pack - Men's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable, warm, and break in well. I wore holes in the front step in both pairs in about 9 months of regular wear. I don't think that's too bad, but anyone e here telling you "they last years" must be wearing lightly!
review.name: Good socks, can't quite get a year of wear

review.itemreviewed: MW Synthetic-Wool Blend Boot Sock - 2-Pack - Men's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This has been my go-to bra for several years. The fit and fabric are comfortable and breathable.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is my daily bra. Comfortable, moisture wicking, and perfect for winter wear as a base layer to the base layer!
review.name: Great comfortable bra

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've had a few of these, and for the most part, I love them. They're comfortable and stay in place. I take the inserts out, so I can't comment on those. Over time, the band does begin to fray and bunch, so I took a star off for that. Overall, though, a good product.
review.name: Comfortable

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits well and more comfortable than a sports bra to wear under workout tops.
review.name: Yes, I'd buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am a 32 DDD and muscular. I ordered the large and it fits well
review.name: I can't have enough of these

review.reviewBody: I waited a bit to submit my review, so I would know if my opinion had changed at all. It hasn't; I absolutely LOVE this bra!!! I have three and have exclusively worn them every single day for a couple of months now, and I couldn't be any happier. Super soft, super comfy, and you still actually have boobs, even being a smaller chested woman. I hope this is never discontinued, because I am a lifer for this bra!!! The tags are easily cut out for comfort, the straps easily adjustable and never fall down. The cups are just thick enough for no accidents, and it breathes!! Love! I'm a 36B and ordered a Large.
review.name: Best bra

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I think the naming "bra inserts" is a bit confusing, and it took me a while to get that this is an actual bra and not the inserts for a bra (hah?). The fabric is two-layered and feels great. Sits tightly, but in a comfortable supporting way. It does have inserts, actually, which I find redundant.
review.name: Looks great, feels great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have wanted to try an Icebreaker bra for years, but was afraid of the wool fabric against my breasts. The inserts made me take a chance. Per the reviews I decided to order a Medium even though I am only a 32 or 34B. I do wish that there was a clasp in the back so that I could adjust, but for now it fits just right. The inserts allow me to wear a tight fitting shirt and look good. I'm so pleased because I won't wear an underwire bra and have never been able to find a natural bra with some padding. By the end of the day I am ready to take it off, but it is softer and more comfortable than I expected.
review.name: I can wear a tight shirt with this bra!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The padded Sirens are wonderful. Reasoably comfortable, smooth, and come in fun colors. So glad I found this wool product. I'm
review.name: The only ones I wear

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, medium was tight and uncomfortable on me (I'm a 34A). I prefer bras on the looser side around the body, so they're not curbing circulation.
review.name: Too tight

name: Siren Bra - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this bag nearly daily since I bought it three or four years ago. I was a bit doubtful at first that it was ‘waterproof’, but it has proved itself again and again in heavy downpours- I put my phone, money, tickets, maps in there with complete confidence! It holds a surprising amount in it and is super comfy worn cross-body. I got the navy blue, which is a lovely soft colour, not the navy of a school uniform!
review.name: Perfect, handy, waterproof bag

review.reviewBody:
Amazing hip pack, stylish, comfortable and lightweight.
Very happy with this purchase!
review.name: Ulvo hip pack

review.reviewBody:
I use this as a cross-body bag for the gym to keep my phone, keys, and wallet from constantly falling out of my pockets. Its also big enough to fit a standard water bottle small cloth to clean machines with. 
The other use for this I've found is going on walks. It's perfect to fit a water bottle and EDC item, like pepper spray or a concealed carry handgun. Its honestly a neat little bag that has a ton of uses.
review.name: Gym Bag / Walking Pouch

review.reviewBody: I have this pack along with the Fjallraven Kanken Hip Pack. It's my adventure pack, the main compartment is easy to access while hiking or biking, and the zippers are smooth once broken in after a few days of use. The material is definitely waterproof, but the zippers aren't taped. The main front pouch has a material flap over the zipper to keep rain from getting in the front pouch, but the back pouch zipper will leak a bit of water depending on how hard it rains, not much, but some in a moderate rain. Would prefer to pay more for waterproof zippers if it were an option, but otherwise a perfect hip pack for all your active pursuits The main storage holds more than you might expect..
review.name: Adventure Pack

review.reviewBody: I can’t carry purses over my shoulder or even across my body due to arthritis.  So when I go out I carry a small backpack.  The problem (to me) was every time I wanted to access my phone, keys, or wallet, I had to swing my pack around and root in the backpack.  I found this medium waist pack by Fjallraven to be the perfect size for my daily use.  It’s not too large (which means I can’t overload it), but large enough to carry my keys, phone, wallet, and a mask.  I also clip on a reusable shopping bag,  I walk a lot, and it is very comfortable.  I bought the Lava Red; it’s a beautiful color.
review.name: Perfect size

review.reviewBody:
I love the capacity of the bag. I love the red gold color. I love the durability. It’s so comfortable to wear. 

But I really wish that the pocket on the back was just 5mm longer so that I could get my big iPhone in and out. Or that the zipper was smaller. My phone technically fits, but it’s difficult to get in and out.

I would also kill for another internal divider to make sure that my AirPods were more completely separated from my sunscreen than just by a mesh divider. Or so I could put my camera in without worrying about it being scratched by my keys or rocks that I pick up on the beach. Or just to make sorting easier. It’s large enough to be a bit of a black hole, and a tiny bit of internal organization like an extra divider or key clip or would make a huge difference.

These aren’t big deals when I am wearing Fjallraven trousers (which have amazing pockets!) and I can put my phone in my real pockets, but it’s enough of a problem that, when I don’t need a full backpack or fancier handbag, I reach for my less attractive and less comfortable mantis the vast majority of the time.
review.name: Almost perfect

review.reviewBody: Love wearing it literally everywhere. It's waterproof so if you get caught in the rain or spill something on yourself your things stay dry. I have the black so it matches everything but I got my stepmom the lava red color and it was wicked cute too and she loves it.
review.name: Such a good daily bag

review.reviewBody: I've been wanting a small pack for outings where I only needed my essentials and finally went with this brand as I could see so many people love it as well. My bag is versatile for sporty and casual day-to-day tasks and adventures and I'm stoked with this decision. I chose the Red Gold color, and the images online reflect its pop of color in person.
review.name: Daily go-to

review.reviewBody:
This is my companion wherever my adventures takes me. It held my bike keys during my LA Laurel canyon hikes, my ski pass in the French alps and my camera hiking in the Scottish mountains of Bennachie. I have grown very attached to this lightweight and multi functional hip pack and I won't travel without it.
Martina S
review.name: My true companion

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love having this as an option when choosing an adventure. I've snowboarded with it around my waist, climbed with it around my chest, used it on day hikes and at street festivals/public events and even attached it to the exterior of my trekking pack as an additional gear pocket for easy to access items. This size is perfect in my opinion, depending on your needs I'm sure a smaller or larger hip pack would be equally as functional.
review.name: Great product, great size, great function

name: Ulvo Medium Hip Pack

review.reviewBody: Have worn 1x but price was right for gd brand, light wt. Need full zip!!
review.name: So far so good

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I stayed dry even in Icelandic rain - a big plus! Proportions are odd...small waist compared to the very generous hips and thighs, then very small ankles. Planning ahead is critical...my hiking boots had to come off to put on the pants.  Proportions weren't a concern with the prior version
review.name: Dry...but odd proportions

review.reviewBody:
Took these on a trip around the Colorado four pass loop. As is typical, we got caught in an afternoon storm at 10,000 feet and suited up. Pants kept us dry from the rain and wete sufficiently breathable for 2 hours of rainy hiking. They are definitely pants to put on BEFORE it rains because the ankle zips don't accommodate footwear too well. But I knew that going in. Zippers are fail points for waters so we elected to minimize the water ingress points. 

Tl;dr kept us dry. Breathed well for intense, medium duration active wear
review.name: Just right

name: Minimalist Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Loved the look of these but they were too small even when I sized up. :(
review.name: Look good, too small

review.reviewBody: Finally, a pair of jeans that fit me perfectly lengthwise! I'm petite (5'2") and petite sizes are often just a shade too short, while regulars are way too long. I think these are supposed to be ankle length, but they are the perfect length for me. I am not completely in love with the button fly yet, but I may come around. I typically wear a size 10, but ordered a size 12 in these, which is my only complaint: they are still ever so slightly snug.
review.name: Perfect length!

review.reviewBody: Love the color, the look and quality! I super excited to find jeans with a leg length option for shorter legs. I am not a fan of the high waist, which I guess is the trend right not. When I sit down, because I am short, my ribs get compressed in the waist band so not the most comfortable jeans to sit in. I probably would not take these traveling.
review.name: Great jeans, not a fan of the high waist

review.reviewBody: I am happy with the fit, color and look!! True to size.
review.name: I am happy with the

review.reviewBody: These jeans far exceeded my expectations! They have a flattering fit and hold their shape nicely. I have a true hourglass body and the jeans fit my narrow waist perfectly while providing room for my round hips!
review.name: Flattering Summer jeans

review.reviewBody: The fit is too small in the hips for my waist. I don't usually have a problem with this but know that a larger size will be too large in the waist for me.
review.name: The fit is too small

review.reviewBody: It’s so difficult to find comfortable jeans. Have to say I love these jeans! So comfy. Quality seems great! Waist sits just below belly button. They run slightly small so order up a size if undecided. I’m 5’5”, 130 lbs. Size 8 fit, but slightly snug. I ended up with a size 10 for a slightly loose fit. Easy exchange policy, no problems.
review.name: It’s so difficult to find

review.reviewBody: Fit great, but the button fly was the reason for the return. Hard to secure and very bulky. I would have kept if they were a standard zipper.
review.name: Button fly

review.reviewBody: Cute, flattering cut. I am either size 8 or 10 (depending on the cut/fit). I'm muscular and curvy in the butt and hips. I took the 10 since they are a straight fit jean and it was a good choice as they are fitted but not tight. Quality denim, right amount of stretch. Love these more than I thought I would based on the photo.
review.name: Flattering

review.reviewBody: Not true to size and can't believe I have to pay a return fee!
review.name: Won't but again

name: Brady Straight Leg Jean - Women's
